title: Historical Setting
objective: Understand author, date, and cultural background impact on meaning

segments.audio_script: This is lesson three. We address historical setting and its interpretive weight.
No passage required. Consider who wrote the text and when it was written.
Historical context includes author intention, audience situation, and social-political background. These factors shape rhetorical aims.
Use external resources like commentaries and atlases to confirm historical claims. Avoid speculative reconstructions without evidence.
Key theme: historical sensitivity reduces anachronism and helps locate author's intended meaning.
Name one element of historical setting that affects interpretation.
This completes lesson three. Next lesson covers literary structure and discourse analysis.

vocabulary.definition: Author, date, audience, and cultural factors surrounding a text

study_notes: Historical research supports but does not override clear textual meaning. Use evidence conservatively.
